From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God that is in Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia.
undefined Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ!Thanksgiving for God’s Comfort
undefined Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
undefined who comforts us in all our troubles so that we may be able to comfort those experiencing any trouble with the com-fort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
undefined For just as the sufferings of Christ overflow toward us, so also our comfort through Christ overflows to you.

undefined But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salva-tion; if we are comforted, it is for your com-fort that you experience in your patient endur-ance of the same sufferings that we also suf-fer.
undefined And our hope for you is steadfast be-cause we know that as you share in our suffer-ings, so also you will share in our comfort.

undefined For we do not want you to be unaware, broth-ers and sisters, regarding the affliction that happened to us in the province of Asia, that we were burdened excessively, beyond our strength, so that we despaired even of living.
undefined Indeed we felt as if the sentence of death had been passed against us, so that we would not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead.
undefined He delivered us from so great a risk of death, and he will deliver us. We have set our hope on him that he will deliver us yet again,
undefined as you also join in helping us by prayer, so that many people may give thanks to God on our behalf for the gracious gift given to us through the help of many.Paul Defends His Changed Plans

undefined For our reason for confidence is this: the testimony of our conscience, that with pure motives and sincerity which are from God – not by human wisdom but by the grace of God – we conducted ourselves in the world, and all the more toward you.
undefined For we do not write you anything other than what you can read and also understand. But I hope that you will understand completely
undefined just as also you have partly understood us, that we are your source of pride just as you also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
undefined And with this con-fidence I intended to come to you first so that you would get a second opportunity to see us,
undefined and through your help to go on into Mac-edonia and then from Macedonia to come back to you and be helped on our way into Judea by you.

undefined Therefore when I was planning to do this, I did not do so without thinking about what I was doing, did I? Or do I make my plans according to mere human standards so that I would be saying both “Yes, yes” and “No, no” at the same time?
undefined But as God is faithful, our message to you is not “Yes” and “No.”
undefined For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, the one who was proclaimed among you by us – by me and Silvanus and Timothy – was not “Yes” and “No,” but it has always been “Yes” in him.
undefined For every one of God’s promises are “Yes” in him; therefore also through him the “Amen” is spoken, to the glory we give to God.
undefined But it is God who establishes us together with you in Christ and who anointed us,
undefined who also sealed us and gave us the Spirit in our hearts as a down payment.Why Paul Postponed His Visit
undefined Now I appeal to God as my witness, that to spare you I did not come again to Cor-inth.
undefined I do not mean that we rule over your faith, but we are workers with you for your joy, because by faith you stand firm.
So I made up my own mind not to pay you another painful visit.
undefined For if I make you sad, who would be left to make me glad but the one I caused to be sad?
undefined And I wrote this very thing to you, so that when I came I would not have sadness from those who ought to make me rejoice, since I am confident in you all that my joy would be yours.
undefined For out of great distress and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not to make you sad, but to let you know the love that I have especially for you.
undefined But if anyone has caused sadness, he has not saddened me alone, but to some extent (not to exaggerate) he has saddened all of you as well.
undefined This punishment on such an indi-vidual by the majority is enough for him,
undefined so that now instead you should rather forgive and comfort him. This will keep him from be-ing overwhelmed by excessive grief to the point of despair.
undefined Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love for him.
undefined For this reason also I wrote you: to test you to see if you are obedient in everything.
undefined If you forgive anyone for anything, I also forgive him – for indeed what I have forgiven (if I have forgiv-en anything) I did so for you in the presence of Christ,
undefined so that we may not be exploited by Satan (for we are not ignorant of his schemes).
undefined Now when I arrived in Troas to proclaim the gospel of Christ, even though the Lord had opened a door of opportunity for me,
undefined I had no relief in my spirit, because I did not find my brother Titus there. So I said good-bye to them and set out for Macedonia.Apostolic Ministry
undefined But thanks be to God who always leads us in triumphal procession in Christ and who makes known through us the fragrance that consists of the knowledge of him in every place.
undefined For we are a sweet aroma of Christ to God among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing –
undefined to the latter an odor from death to death, but to the former a fragrance from life to life. And who is adequate for these things?

undefined For we are not like so many others, hucksters who peddle the word of God for profit, but we are speak-ing in Christ before God as persons of sinceri-ty, as persons sent from God.A Living Letter
Are we beginning to commend our-selves again? We don’t need letters of recom-mendation to you or from you as some other people do, do we?
undefined You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone,
undefined revealing that you are a letter of Christ, delivered by us, written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on stone tablets but on tablets of human hearts.
undefined Now we have such confidence in God through Christ.
undefined Not that we are adequate in ourselves to consider anything as if it were coming from ourselves, but our adequacy is from God,
undefined who made us adequate to be servants of a new covenant not based on the letter but on the Spirit, for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.The Greater Glory of the Spirit’s Ministry

undefined But if the ministry that produced death – carved in letters on stone tablets – came with glory, so that the Israelites could not keep their eyes fixed on the face of Moses because of the glory of his face (a glory which was made ineffective),
undefined how much more glorious will the ministry of the Spirit be?
undefined For if there was glory in the ministry that produced con-demnation, how much more does the ministry that produces righteousness excel in glory!
undefined For indeed, what had been glorious now has no glory because of the tremendously greater glory of what replaced it.
undefined For if what was made ineffective came with glory, how much more has what remains come in glory!
undefined Therefore, since we have such a hope, we behave with great boldness,
undefined and not like Moses who used to put a veil over his face to keep the Israelites from staring at the result of the glory that was made ineffective.
undefined But their minds were closed. For to this very day, the same veil remains when they hear the old covenant read. It has not been removed because only in Christ is it taken away.
undefined But until this very day whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their minds,
undefined but when one turns to the Lord, the veil is re-moved.
undefined Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is present, there is freedom.

undefined And we all, with unveiled faces reflecting the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from one degree of glory to another, which is from the Lord, who is the Spirit.Paul’s Perseverance in Ministry
Therefore, since we have this ministry, just as God has shown us mercy, we do not become discouraged.

undefined But we have rejected shameful hidden deeds, not behaving with deceptiveness or distorting the word of God, but by open proclamation of the truth we commend ourselves to everyone’s conscience before God.
undefined But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled only to those who are per-ishing,
undefined among whom the god of this age has blinded the minds of those who do not believe so they would not see the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God.
undefined For we do not proclaim ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your slaves for Jesus’ sake.

undefined For God, who said “Let light shine out of darkness,” is the one who shined in our hearts to give us the light of the glorious knowledge of God in the face of Christ.An Eternal Weight of Glory
undefined But we have this treasure in clay jars, so that the extraordinary power belongs to God and does not come from us.
undefined We are experiencing trouble on every side, but are not crushed; we are perplexed, but not driven to despair;
undefined we are persecuted, but not aban-doned; we are knocked down, but not de-stroyed,
undefined always carrying around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be made visible in our body.
undefined For we who are alive are constantly being handed over to death for Jesus’ sake, so that the life of Jesus may also be made visible in our mortal body.
undefined As a result, death is at work in us, but life is at work in you.
undefined But since we have the same spirit of faith as that shown in what has been written, “I believed; therefore I spoke,” we also believe, therefore we also speak.
undefined We do so because we know that the one who raised up Jesus will also raise us up with Jesus and will bring us with you into his presence.
undefined For all these things are for your sake, so that the grace that is including more and more people may cause thanksgiving to increase to the glory of God.
undefined Therefore we do not despair, but even if our physical body is wearing away, our inner person is being renewed day by day.
undefined For our momentary, light suffering is producing for us an eternal weight of glory far beyond all comparison
undefined because we are not looking at what can be seen but at what cannot be seen. For what can be seen is temporary, but what cannot be seen is eternal.Living by Faith, Not by Sight
For we know that if our earthly house, the tent we live in, is dismantled, we have a building from God, a house not built by hu-man hands, that is eternal in the heavens.
undefined For in this earthly house we groan, because we desire to put on our heavenly dwelling,
undefined if indeed, after we have put on our heavenly house, we will not be found naked.
undefined For we groan while we are in this tent, since we are weighed down, because we do not want to be unclothed, but clothed, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.
undefined Now the one who prepared us for this very purpose is God, who gave us the Spirit as a down payment.
undefined Therefore we are always full of courage, and we know that as long as we are alive here on earth we are absent from the Lord –
undefined for we live by faith, not by sight.
undefined Thus we are full of courage and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.
undefined So then whether we are alive or away, we make it our ambition to please him.

undefined For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each one may be paid back according to what he has done while in the body, wheth-er good or evil.The Message of Reconciliation
undefined Therefore, because we know the fear of the Lord, we try to persuade people, but we are well known to God, and I hope we are well known to your consciences too.

undefined We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to be proud of us, so that you may be able to answer those who take pride in outward appearance and not in what is in the heart.
undefined For if we are out of our minds, it is for God; if we are of sound mind, it is for you.
undefined For the love of Christ controls us, since we have concluded this, that Christ died for all; therefore all have died.
undefined And he died for all so that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised.

undefined So then from now on we acknowledge no one from an outward human point of view. Even though we have known Christ from such a human point of view, now we do not know him in that way any longer.
undefined So then, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; what is old has passed away – look, what is new has come!
undefined And all these things are from God who reconciled us to himself through Christ, and who has given us the ministry of reconcili-ation.
undefined In other words, in Christ God was reconciling the world to himself, not counting people’s trespasses against them, and he has given us the message of reconciliation.
undefined Therefore we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were making His plea through us. We plead with you on Christ’s behalf, “Be reconciled to God!”
undefined God made the one who did not know sin to be sin for us, so that in him we would become the righteousness of God.God’s Suffering Servants
Now because we are fellow workers, we also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain.
undefined For he says, “I heard you at the acceptable time, and in the day of salva-tion I helped you.” Look, now is the accepta-ble time; look, now is the day of salvation!
undefined We do not give anyone an occasion for taking an offense in anything, so that no fault may be found with our ministry.
undefined But as God’s servants, we have commended ourselves in every 	way, with great endurance, in persecutions, in difficulties, in distresses,
undefined in beatings, in imprisonments, in riots, in troubles, in sleepless nights, in hunger,
undefined by purity, by knowledge, by patience, by benevolence, by the Holy Spir-it, by genuine love,
undefined by truthful teaching, by the power of God, with weapons of righteous-ness both for the right hand and for the left,
undefined through glory and dishonor, through slan-der and praise; regarded as impostors, and yet true;
undefined as unknown, and yet well-known; as dying and yet – see! – we continue to live; as those who are scourged and yet not executed;
undefined as sorrowful, but always rejoicing, as poor, but making many rich, as having nothing, and yet possessing everything.
undefined We have spoken freely to you, Corin-thians; our heart has been opened wide to you.
undefined Our affection for you is not restricted, but you are restricted in your affections for us.
undefined Now as a fair exchange – I speak as to my children – open wide your hearts to us also.Unequal Partners
undefined Do not become partners with those who do not believe, for what partnership is there between righteousness and lawlessness, or what fellowship does light have with dark-ness?
undefined And what agreement does Christ have with Beliar? Or what does a believer share in common with an unbeliever?

undefined And what mutual agreement does the temple of God have with idols? For we are the temple of the living God, just as God said, “I will live in them and will walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be my people.”
undefined Therefore “come out from their midst, and be separate,” says the Lord, “and touch no un-clean thing, and I will welcome you,
undefined and I will be a father to you, and you will be my sons and daughters,” says the All-Powerful Lord.
Therefore, since we have these promis-es, dear friends, let us cleanse ourselves from everything that could defile the body and the spirit, and thus accomplish holiness out of reverence for God.
undefined Make room for us in your hearts; we have wronged no one, we have ruined no one, we have exploited no one.
undefined I do not say this to condemn you, for I told you before that you are in our hearts so that we die together and live together with you.A Letter That Caused Sadness
undefined I have great confidence in you; I take great pride on your behalf. I am filled with encouragement; I am overflowing with joy in the midst of all our suffering.
undefined For even when we came into Macedonia, our body had no rest at all, but we were troubled in every way – struggles from the outside, fears from within.
undefined But God, who encourages the downhearted, encouraged us by the arrival of Titus.

undefined We were encouraged not only by his arrival, but also by the encouragement you gave him, as he reported to us your longing, your mourning, your deep concern for me, so that I rejoiced more than ever.
undefined For even if I made you sad by my letter, I do not regret having written it (even though I did regret it, for I see that my letter made you sad, though only for a short time).
undefined Now I rejoice, not because you were made sad, but because you were made sad to the point of repentance. For you were made sad as God intended, so that you were not harmed in any way by us.
undefined For sadness as intended by God produces a repentance that leads to salvation, leaving no regret, but worldly sadness brings about death.

undefined For see what this very thing, this sadness as God intended, has produced in you: what eagerness, what defense of yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what deep concern, what punishment! In everything you have proved yourselves to be innocent in this matter.
undefined So then, even though I wrote to you, it was not on account of the one who did wrong, or on account of the one who was wronged, but to reveal to you your eagerness on our behalf before God.
undefined Therefore we have been encouraged. And in addition to our own encouragement, we rejoiced even more at the joy of Titus, because all of you have re-freshed his spirit.

undefined For if I have boasted to him about anything concerning you, I have not been embarrassed by you, but just as every-thing we said to you was true, so our boasting to Titus about you has proved true as well.
undefined And his affection for you is much greater when he remembers the obedience of you all, how you welcomed him with fear and trem-bling.
undefined I rejoice because in everything I am fully confident in you.Completing the Collection for the Saints
Now we make known to you, brothers and sisters, the grace of God given to the churches of Macedonia,
undefined that during a se-vere ordeal of suffering, their abundant joy and their extreme poverty have overflowed in the wealth of their generosity.
undefined For I testify, they gave according to their means and be-yond their means. They did so voluntarily,
undefined begging us with great earnestness for the bless-ing and fellowship of helping the saints.
undefined And they did this not just as we had hoped, but they gave themselves first to the Lord and to us by the will of God.
undefined Thus we urged Titus that, just as he had previously begun this work, so also he should complete this act of kindness for you.
undefined But as you excel in eve-rything – in faith, in speech, in knowledge, and in all eagerness and in the love from us that is in you – make sure that you excel in this act of kindness too.
undefined I am not saying this as a command, but I am testing the genuineness of your love by comparison with the eagerness of others.
undefined For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that although he was rich, he became poor for your sakes, so that you by his poverty could become rich.
undefined So here is my opinion on this matter: It is to your ad-vantage, since you made a good start last year both in your giving and your desire to give,
undefined to finish what you started, so that just as you wanted to do it eagerly, you can also complete it according to your means.
undefined For if the eagerness is present, the gift itself is acceptable according to whatever one has, not according to what he does not have.
undefined For I do not say this so there would be relief for others and suffering for you, but as a matter of equality.
undefined At the present time, your abun-dance will meet their need, so that one day their abundance may also meet your need, and thus there may be equality,
undefined as it is written: “The one who gathered much did not have too much, and the one who gathered little did not have too little.”The Mission of Titus
undefined But thanks be to God who put in the heart of Titus the same devotion I have for you,
undefined because he not only accepted our request, but since he was very eager, he is coming to you of his own accord.
undefined And we are sending along with him the brother who is praised by all the churches for his work in spreading the gospel.

undefined In addition, this brother has also been chosen by the churches as our traveling companion as we administer this generous gift to the glory of the Lord him-self and to show our readiness to help.
undefined We did this as a precaution so that no one should blame us in regard to this generous gift we are administering.
undefined For we are con-cerned about what is right not only before the Lord but also before men.

undefined And we are sending with them our brother whom we have tested many times and found eager in many matters, but who now is much more eager than ever because of the great confidence he has in you.
undefined If there is any question about Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker among you; if there is any question about our broth-ers, they are messengers of the churches, a glory to Christ.
undefined Therefore show them openly before the churches the proof of your love and of our pride in you.Preparing the Gift
For it is not necessary for me to write you about this service to the saints,

undefined because I know your eagerness to help. I keep boasting to the Macedonians about this eagerness of yours, that Achaia has been ready to give since last year, and your zeal to participate has stirred up most of them.
undefined But I am sending these brothers so that our boasting about you may not be empty in this case, so that you may be ready just as I kept telling them.
undefined For if any of the Macedonians should come with me and find that you are not ready to give, we would be humiliated (not to mention you) by this confidence we had in you.

undefined Therefore I thought it necessary to urge these brothers to go to you in advance and to arrange ahead of time the generous contribution you had prom-ised, so this may be ready as a generous gift and not as something you feel forced to do.
undefined My point is this: The person who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the per-son who sows generously will also reap gener-ously.
undefined Each one of you should give just as he has decided in his heart, not reluctantly or under compulsion, because God loves a cheer-ful giver.
undefined And God is able to make all grace overflow to you so that because you have enough of everything in every way at all times, you will overflow in every good work.
undefined Just as it is written, “He has scattered widely, he has given to the poor; his right-eousness remains forever.”
undefined Now God who provides seed for the sower and bread for food will provide and multiply your supply of seed and will cause the harvest of your right-eousness to grow.
undefined You will be enriched in every way so that you may be generous on every occasion, which is producing through us thanksgiving to God,
undefined because the service of this ministry is not only providing for the needs of the saints but is also overflowing with many thanks to God.

undefined Through the evidence of this service they will glorify God because of your obedience to your confession in the gospel of Christ and the generosity of your sharing with them and with everyone.
undefined And in their prayers on your behalf they long for you because of the extraordinary grace God has shown to you.
undefined Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!Paul’s Authority from the Lord
Now I, Paul, appeal to you personally by the meekness and gentleness of Christ (I who am meek when present among you, but am full of courage toward you when away!) –
undefined now I ask that when I am present I may not have to be bold with the confidence that (I expect) I will dare to use against some who consider us to be behaving according to human standards.
undefined For though we live as human beings, we do not wage war according to hu-man standards,
undefined for the weapons of our warfare are not human weapons, but are made powerful by God for tearing down strong-holds. We tear down arguments
undefined and every arrogant obstacle that is raised up against the knowledge of God, and we take every thought captive to make it obey Christ.
undefined We are also ready to punish every act of disobedience, whenever your obedience is complete.
undefined You are looking at outward appearances. If anyone is confident that he belongs to Christ, he should reflect on this again: Just as he him-self belongs to Christ, so too do we.
undefined For if I boast somewhat more about our authority that the Lord gave us for building you up and not for tearing you down, I will not be ashamed of doing so.
undefined I do not want to seem as though I am trying to terrify you with my letters,
undefined because some say, “His letters are weighty and forceful, but his physical presence is weak and his speech is of no ac-count.”
undefined Let such a person consider this: What we say by letters when we are absent, we also are in actions when we are present.Paul’s Mission

undefined For we would not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some of those who recommend themselves. But when they meas-ure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they are without understanding.
undefined But we will not boast beyond certain limits, but will confine our boasting according to the limits of the work to which God has appointed us, that reaches even as far as you.
undefined For we were not overex-tending ourselves, as though we did not reach as far as you, because we were the first to reach as far as you with the gospel about Christ.
undefined Nor do we boast beyond certain limits in the work done by others, but we hope that as your faith continues to grow, our work may be greatly expanded among you accord-ing to our limits,
undefined so that we may preach the gospel in the regions that lie beyond you, and not boast of work already done in another person’s area.
undefined But the one who boasts must boast in the Lord.
undefined For it is not the person who commends himself who is ap-proved, but the person the Lord commends.Paul and His Opponents
I wish that you would be patient with me in a little foolishness, but indeed you are being patient with me!
undefined For I am jealous for you with godly jealousy, because I prom-ised you in marriage to one husband, to pre-sent you as a pure virgin to Christ.
undefined But I am afraid that just as the serpent deceived Eve by his treachery, your minds may be led astray from a sincere and pure devotion to Christ.

undefined For if someone comes and proclaims an-other Jesus different from the one we pro-claimed, or if you receive a different spirit than the one you received, or a different gos-pel than the one you accepted, you put up with it well enough!
undefined For I consider myself not at all inferior to those “super-apostles.”
undefined And even if I am unskilled in speaking, yet I am certainly not so in knowledge. Indeed, we have made this plain to you in everything in every way.
undefined Or did I commit a sin by humbling myself so that you could be exalted, because I proclaimed the gospel of God to you free of charge?
undefined I robbed other churches by receiving support from them so that I could serve you!

undefined When I was with you and was in need, I was not a burden to anyone, for the brothers who came from Macedonia fully sup-plied my needs. I kept myself from being a burden to you in any way, and will continue to do so.
undefined As the truth of Christ is in me, this boasting of mine will not be stopped in the regions of Achaia.
undefined Why? Because I do not love you? God knows I do!
undefined And what I am doing I will continue to do, so that I may eliminate any opportunity for those who want a chance to be regarded as our equals in the things they boast about.
undefined For such people are false apostles, deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ.
undefined And no wonder, for even Satan disguis-es himself as an angel of light.
undefined Therefore it is not surprising his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness, whose end will correspond to their actions. Paul’s Sufferings for Christ
undefined I say again, let no one think that I am a fool. But if you do, then at least accept me as a fool, so that I too may boast a little.
undefined What I am saying with this boastful confi-dence I do not say the way the Lord would. Instead it is, as it were, foolishness.
undefined Since many are boasting according to human standards, I too will boast.
undefined For since you are so wise, you put up with fools gladly.

undefined For you put up with it if someone makes slaves of you, if someone exploits you, if someone takes advantage of you, if someone behaves arrogantly toward you, if someone strikes you in the face.
undefined (To my disgrace I must say that we were too weak for that!) But whatever anyone else dares to boast about (I am speak-ing foolishly), I also dare to boast about the same thing.
undefined Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they de-scendants of Abraham? So am I.

undefined Are they servants of Christ? (I am talking like I am out of my mind!) I am even more so: with much greater labors, with far more imprison-ments, with more severe beatings, facing death many times.
undefined Five times I received from the Jews forty lashes less one.
undefined Three times I was beaten with a rod. Once I received a stoning. Three times I suffered shipwreck. A night and a day I spent adrift in the open sea.

undefined I have been on journeys many times, in dangers from rivers, in dangers from robbers, in dangers from my own countrymen, in dan-gers from Gentiles, in dangers in the city, in dangers in the wilderness, in dangers at sea, in dangers from false brothers,
undefined in hard work and toil, through many sleepless nights, in hunger and thirst, many times without food, in cold and without enough clothing.
undefined Apart from other things, there is the daily pressure on me of my anxious concern for all the churches.
undefined Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is led into sin, and I do not burn with indignation?
undefined If I must boast, I will boast about the things that show my weakness.
undefined The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, who is blessed forever, knows I am not lying.
undefined In Damascus, the governor under King Aretas was guarding the city of Damascus in order to arrest me,
undefined but I was let down in a rope-basket through a window in the city wall, and escaped his hands.Paul’s Thorn in the Flesh
It is necessary to go on boasting. Though it is not profitable, I will go on to vi-sions and revelations from the Lord.
undefined I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows) was caught up to the third heaven.
undefined And I know that this man (whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, God knows)
undefined was caught up into paradise and heard things too sacred to be put into words, things that a person is not permitted to speak.
undefined On behalf of such an individual I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except about my weaknesses.
undefined For even if I wish to boast, I will not be a fool, for I would be telling the truth, but I refrain from this so that no one may regard me beyond what he sees in me or what he hears from me,

undefined even because of the extraordi-nary character of the revelations. Therefore, so that I would not become arrogant, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Sa-tan to trouble me – so that I would not become arrogant.
undefined I asked the Lord three times about this, that it would depart from me.

undefined But he said to me, “My grace is enough for you, for my power is made perfect in weak-ness.” So then, I will boast most gladly about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may reside in me.

undefined Therefore I am content with weaknesses, with insults, with troubles, with persecutions and difficulties for the sake of Christ, for whenever I am weak, then I am strong.The Signs of an Apostle
undefined I have become a fool. You your-selves forced me to do it, for I should have been commended by you. For I lack nothing in comparison to those “super-apostles,” even though I am nothing.
undefined Indeed, the signs of an apostle were performed among you with great perseverance by signs and wonders and powerful deeds.
undefined For how were you treated worse than the other churches, except that I myself was not a burden to you? Forgive me this injustice!

undefined Look, for the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden to you, because I do not want your possessions, but you. For children should not have to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.
undefined Now I will most glad-ly spend and be spent for your lives! If I love you more, am I to be loved less?
undefined But be that as it may, I have not burdened you. Yet because I was a crafty person, I took you in by deceit!
undefined I have not taken advantage of you through anyone I have sent to you, have I?

undefined I urged Titus to visit you and I sent our brother along with him. Titus did not take advantage of you, did he? Did we not conduct ourselves in the same spirit? Did we not be-have in the same way?
undefined Have you been thinking all this time that we have been de-fending ourselves to you? We are speaking in Christ before God, and everything we do, dear friends, is to build you up.

undefined For I am afraid that somehow when I come I will not find you what I wish, and you will find me not what you wish. I am afraid that somehow there may be quarreling, jealousy, intense an-ger, selfish ambition, slander, gossip, arro-gance, and disorder.

undefined I am afraid that when I come again, my God may humiliate me before you, and I will grieve for many of those who previously sinned and have not repented of the impurity, sexual immorality, and licen-tiousness that they have practiced.Paul’s Third Visit to Corinth
This is the third time I am coming to visit you. By the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter will be established.
undefined I said before when I was present the second time and now, though absent, I say again to those who sinned previously and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare anyone,
undefined since you are demanding proof that Christ is speaking through me. He is not weak toward you but is powerful among you.
undefined For in-deed he was crucified by reason of weakness, but he lives because of God’s power. For we also are weak in him, but we will live together with him, because of God’s power toward you.
undefined Put yourselves to the test to see if you are in the faith; examine yourselves! Or do you not recognize regarding yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you – unless, indeed, you fail the test!
undefined And I hope that you will realize that we have not failed the test!
undefined Now we pray to God that you may not do anything wrong, not so that we may appear to have passed the test, but so that you may do what is right even if we may appear to have failed the test.
undefined For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the sake of the truth.
undefined For we rejoice whenever we are weak, but you are strong. And we pray for this: that you may become fully qualified.

undefined Because of this I am writing these things while absent, so that when I arrive I may not have to deal harshly with you by using my authority – the Lord gave it to me for building up, not for tearing down!Final Exhortations and Greetings
undefined Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice, set things right, be encouraged, agree with one another, live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.
undefined Greet one anoth-er with a holy kiss. All the saints greet you.
undefined The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Ho-ly Spirit be with you all.
